title: Who is Geoffrey Howe? In 60 seconds
text:
Who is Geoffrey Howe? In 60 seconds Geoffrey Howe has died at the age of 88, watch who Geoffrey Howe was in 60 seconds By Video by Robert Midgley , words by Tim Ross 1:19PM BST 10 Oct 2015 
Geoffrey Howe , the Conservative former Cabinet minister, has died. He was 88. 
In a statement, Lord Howe's family said he died on Friday night after suffering a suspected heart attack. 
Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher and Geoffrey Howe in the first House of Commons TV broadcast in 1989 
His career in parliament spanned half a century and saw him serve as chancellor, foreign secretary, leader of the Commons, and deputy prime minister in the governments led by Mrs Thatcher. 
In 1992, he was awarded a life-peer of the House of Lords and retired in May 2015. 
Geoffrey Howe in 1995 
Lord Howe is likely to be remembered for the dramatic resignation statement he made in November 1990, a speech that stunned the Commons and triggered the leadership challenge that ultimately forced Mrs Thatcher from Number 10. 
In a scathing resignation speech from the backbenches, Lord Howe criticised Mrs Thatcher’s approach to Europe and her “no, no, no” speech to further integration.
